title: 6.9 balance hotfix going out soon
body:
Hey all,

We've got a balance hotfix that, all going according to plan, should be going out sometime late this week or early next week. It contains small to moderate buffs to Swain, Vlad and Cass and a small to moderate nerf to Malz. Our expectation is that we'll do additional work on each of those champions in the next patch too (these changes won't address all their issues). This hotfix isn't intended to be a massive change, more to take the edge off major balance outliers while we assess the reworked kit's learning curves, the state of the meta and work on additional changes. We're also looking at whether the Ocean Drake buff is too strong with one stack and might also make adjustments to that before 6.10, not sure yet.

Tentative change lists:

Cassiopeia: More useability and general power on Twin Fangs. Future changes (non hotfix) likely to focus on other skills)

* E Cooldown to 0.75 from 0.9
* E Mana cost to 40-80 from 60-80
* E Range back to the previous range model (700 range center to center instead of 550 range edge to edge). On average slightly longer against small targets (like most other mid laners and minions), slightly shorter against large targets (like most tanks)


Malzahar: Higher mana costs to constrain pushing and jungling, less safe jungling, slightly weaker ult

* Q mana cost to 80 from 60
* W mana cost to 80 from 60
* Neutral monster damage reduction to 50% from 75%
* R damage to 5/7/9% from 6/8/10%


Swain: Increased damage on Q to account for its lower consistency, bug fix

* Q damage to 30-110 from 25-85
* R cast time on toggle on removed (unintended, shouldn't have shipped)


Vlad: Adding power, mid game especially, and increasing healing from empowered Q, in part to offset E cost

* Q empowered missing health ratio increased to 4% AP from 2.5%
* E base damage increased to 30-90/60-180 from 30-70/60-140

replies.body: Oh, also just for clarity's sake it's worth mentioning there are a lot of other champions we're looking at as possible buff or nerf candidates in 6.10. Hotfixes involve some risk though, both on the technical side (less testing/implementation time) and the on the design side (reacting quickly off limited data and analysis). As a result we're only hotfixing the extremes, even if there are other champions, items etc that will almost certainly receive changes in the next patch.

The problem with Vladimir isn't the damage on E or the healing on Q.

It's the absolute lack of damage on Q and the incredibly small window to use Crimson Rush on TOP of the MS steroid being so pathetically weak that the other two Transfusions are completely meaningless.

The problem with E isn't that it doesn't do enough damage, it's that it's INSANELY telegraphed to the point any non-Bronze player will never get hit by it. Make the hurtbox invisible to enemy champions and just flat out remove the movement nerf to self and you can fix that ability outright.

What is Riot's thoughts on current rageblade, bloodrazor, and the champions who use them? 

From my experience the new rageblade is really underwhelming on almost any melee champion

Rageblade's probably on the weak side, we wanted to err in that direction and tune up if needs be though rather than the opposite given how dominant its been this season (get a look at which champs are dependent on it, which just like it etc). 

Bloodrazor's looking like it might be too weak, lot of champions its the best choice for are struggling. Might also be some champs who'd been nerfed due to how powerful they were in a game with Devourer we can put power back into now, not sure yet.

If Rageblade is on the weak side, might I suggest giving the item more attack speed, it did lose a little bit of it's attack speed due to having less stacks and the item doesn't give attack speed on it's own without stacking. In addition, when upgrading to rageblade, you lose 25% of the attack speed you would gain from recurve bow once you upgrade.

Is there a chance at you looking at the individual champions that used it before? Im not an expert on balancing but I can't imagine it's healthy for champions to only be good when depending on such broken items 

I'll use Jax as an example because I play him a lot, ever since his massive base stat nerfs 2 years ago he hasn't fully recovered as a staple competitive pick or solo queue pick until rageblade was introduced this preseason. He wasn't picked once at worlds in s4 or s5. 

Would it be better to give the individual champions some power instead of making rageblade so powerful again?

We'll be looking at both champion and item states yeah. Will generally want to avoid significant changes to both at once though. Whether we change a kit or an item will also depend a lot on the wider balance state. If most champions of a type are struggling that often suggests their items aren't up to par. If it's only certain champs, kit solutions are usually more appropriate.

But with many of those "on-hit tanky" champions like Jax/Shyv, they were decently balanced until the double-hit passive was introduced, after which specifically Shyvana's kit was fairly severely hit, especially early, followed by the removal of Devourer, which was what was the cause of them being broken. Is there a reason you don't comment on the clunkiness of Vlad's kit that prevents him from accomplishing what his kit says to do?

The missing health ratio is not going to make his problem areas any better, even if it is an appreciated buff for balancing E's cost. 

E's base damage doesn't need buffing at all. E is the only part of Vlad's kit that DOESN'T need changes, outside of maybe the E release delay that freezes him for half a second. 

Seriously, his Q's delay along with the particle is all that's keeping Vlad from functioning properly. Try mitigating that and you'll see him in a way better place, and it won't feel terrible to play him anymore either.

If you keep his own kit holding him back no matter what he wants to do, he will never feel rewarding until you buff him to the point of being overbearing. PLEASE consider QoL changes first before you buff Vlad too much and then proceed to gut him and leave him there until his next rework.

Malz's ult damage component is pretty useless. I literally only use it in a fight were a priority target needs to be stopped so the team can focus them. Even pulling off a perfect combo and having your voidling go to town on the champ during the ult they will definitely survive unless they are dumb. 

biggest issue malz has lost his ability to be anti assassin.

Vlad's E _does not_ need more damage. I've been able to regularly get it to hit for upwards of 400 damage, sometimes even in the 700-900 damage range. It's not a place where he's weak so please, please consider buffing him where it's needed, like his Q damage, cooldown or the crimson rush duration.

Is there a reason you don't do mechanical touch-ups on Vlad?

His old kit was balanced by how much his Q and E delays constrained his movement. 

With the new kit, there's much more counterplay and such long delays should not be necessary. 

Especially on Q, since you cannot get clutch heals off like the ability wants you to. The reward of his Q often isn't there simply because you CANNOT get it before you die often enough. The delay feels insanely long now with the pattern Vlad follows.

It makes me sad, especially since it takes a full 1-2 seconds during the time you're vulnerable after W until you get a heal off Q. I'm usually dead from the ADC alone before the heal particle reaches me, even if I was above half health. 


Basically, my point is that his current cast animations were there to limit his old kit. In his new kit, they're just an artificial way to make him weaker...and it feels terrible for the user on top of the new unreliability of his kit. Before you do significant buffs, you should think about making QoL changes to Vlad. That would solve a lot of his kit's current issues, and you can follow up with balance after that if he proves to be out of line.

Hi Meddler, a lot of the concern for Malz seems to be regarding his new passive. Having the damage and CC-reduction stay for a second, after it's procced, on top of the 90% damage reduction and its consistent up-time has played a huge part in his overall game dominance.  Why is it being avoided altogether when his skills already received an overall nerf across the board (Q and R specifically) with the rework?

Similarly, Vlad's issue is largely felt as that the non-empowered Q is far too weak to be used to trade in any measure and that the window of Blood Rush is far too short for the weak buff that it gives (especially with regards to the almost imperceptible movement speed boost). Wouldn't it be a better move to action some change in those areas as opposed to the proposed buffs? 

Tweaks are good, but these seem to be targeting the wrong things entirely.

We'll probably look at Malz's passive in 6.10. It's a type of effect that's pretty difficult to hotfix, hence its exclusion from the first round of changes.

Not sure on Vlad yet in terms of other changes likely, will certainly discuss Q concerns with the team though.

Hi, main malzahar from euw here, since s4 (more than 50% of my games are played with malz), and im a little sad with the directions of the changes (Im happy with the mini-rework), so i hope you read/answer this.

I just want to tell you that changes for Malzahar will make him suffer even more in mid, being AP. 

The real problem is that he has gone too weak for going mid, he cant just 1v1 anyone anymore, without a bunch of items. Thats because his R, thats the 1st problem in his new kit.

Why dont you try to improve the interaction between W and R instead of nerfing both? For example

* A little bonus flat damage on R if a voidling hit (That means recover the base damage from R)
* Make his voidlings enrage and be invulnerable within R area (50% extra as, added to the extra 50%, 100%)
* Make the voidlings spawn rate 2x when hitting a E or R target (2 voidlings per hit, so you can use W while R and you have dps and enough damage for nuking someone, but giving him time to react)
* Lower R cd, cause now its not as powerful as before (you can avoid the area easily, and you can remove the CC)


R is his main tool being AP mid to be effective in TF and similar (Supress 1, delete 1, 4v5). You give him the E reset combo, you can poke and push like before (harder, but ok), but if you buff his R you will take him back to mid, if you nerf him one and other time he will just hide in jungle, cause he is getting out of his "meta" pick, cause he cant trade or make others out of the lane (Mains Yasuo will be extremely happy with his changes/nerfs, now yas can just wreck malz cause he relies on burst, and malz on dps, and his R will be just completely eaten by his passive)


(Maokai is a tank, and with his W he deals 9 / 10 / 11 / 12 / 13% (+ 3% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health , rooting them also, with a low cd...)

If you nerf his mana cost, you will push him more into jungle, cause being jungle you dont really need that 20 mana that you REALLY need in lane, having blue and jungle item passive... And the 25% nerf to neutral monsters will hit him twice, cause his only "good" pick now will be nerfed, and he will suffer in jungle and in lane.



Remember that doing an early drake or baron solo =/= OP jungler. He struggles in ganks, he excels at taking objectives, he excels ganking at 6 with R. Hes just some kind of AP Warwick, with a better learning curve. Many champs can solo baron with just 2 items ({{champion:19}}  {{champion:266}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:24}} , etc) and any champ with enough sustain or as or damage solo dragon at lvl 2-3, you cant punish malzahar for doing that, will be just unfair.

Take [this post](http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/es/c/campeones-y-jugabilidad-es/Au4wkhyM-parche-69-rework-magos-malzahar-cambios-theorycrafting-y-guias) as as proof that I like to analyze in depth this champion, I love his kit, his lore, his style, and ill play him being op, nerfed or normal, but please, i beg you, reconsider the changes to a better way, dont just nerfhammer him til he transforms in Skarner 2.0, dont take out his utility, dont make him un-fun to play.



And sorry for my bad english, if i made some mistakes. I really, really hope you can answer this comment.
